intro: Deppea chimalaparum, commonly known as the Chimalapa mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
